alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland Indian River; Inland St. Lucie; Okeechobee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 5:17PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Okeechobee, southwestern Indian River, and northern St. Lucie Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 514 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Kissimmee Prairie Preserve to near Fort Drum to 8 miles south of Blue Cypress Lake. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Pierce, Fort Drum, Indrio, Vero Beach South and Pointe West. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. ightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
